text: Role of NFkappaB , <extra_id_0> NFIL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NFAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding in LPS - , <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - , GP - , GP + LPS - and GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression by human PBMC

Because GP induced band shifts to NFkappaB , NFIL-6 and NFAT sites , but no <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we hypothesized that the activated transcription factors might bind to sites in the <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

We investigated previoulsy described and newly discovered transcription factor binding sites of the <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter ( Table 1 ) using the program OMIGA ( v.1.1.3 , Oxford Molecular , Oxford , UK ) .

The LPS responsive kappaB consensus site of LRE-1 ( between -84 and -93 ) [ 30 ] displayed band shifts , but no significant alterations of its binding activity , irrespective of the treatment ( data not shown ) .

A new kappaB3 site ( -100 and -130 ) within the LRE-1 [ 30 ] showed increased binding induced by <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( +30 % vs . control ) , but GP co-treatment up-regulated the LPS ( +65 % vs . control ) - and the <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( +110 % vs . control ) - induced binding in a superadditive synergistic fashion , when compared to medium control as well as to LPS , <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or GP or the theoretical values of GP / LPS calc .
Binding to a new kappaB consensus site ( between -266 and -280 ) was significantly elevated for GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( p < 0.05 ; data not shown ) .

The LPS - , <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and GP + LPS - induced binding to the new kappaB2 / 3 site ( -288 and -302 ) was down-regulated by about 20-35 % in comparison with medium control ( p < 0.05 ; data not shown ) .
The NFIL-6 site ( -147 and -170 ) close to LRE-2 [ 31 , 32 ] showed an up-regulation of binding for all compounds and combinations vs . medium control , ranging from 25-110 % ( p < 0.05 ) .

Further , GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced an increased binding to the NFIL-6 site in comparison with <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 1.3fold ) or GP ( 1.6fold ; p < 0.05 ) , ( data not shown ) .

A new binding site for NFATP2 / 3 was found more distal of the transcription start site , between -471 and -490 , displaying again a substantial increase of binding for all compounds and combinations , when compared to medium control ( p < 0.05 ) .

In addition , binding to the NFATP2 / 3 site following both , GP + LPS ( 1.4fold of GP ) and GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 1.5fold of GP , 1.25fold of <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) was elevated ( p < 0.05 ; Fig . 5 ) , but only in an additive synergistic manner , i.e . the experimental results were not different from the theoretical values ( calc . )
